Very briefly, I am not at all doubtful that Frank’s failure to report
to you and the Board on the financial status of KAEB has been most annoying
and certainly if he has been derelict in his duties he needs to be nulled
up by the boot straps. Y0ur letter of December 28, however, was too strong
particularly in view of your having forwarded copies to members of the Board
It could result only in completely antagonising Frank and should never have
been written. Please consider yourself duly spanked.
May I reaffirm my absolute confidence in what you are doing and my
Appreciation for the very excellent way in which you have always conducted
life.KB affairs. I think I have a clearer picture than anyone of the enormous
amount of work and thought and the large portion of your heart that you ha e
poured into this organization. All of the membership are grateful to you
and all of us are extremely proud of you.
You must realise, however, that few people are as efficient as you are
In handling their own problems, as well as organizational jobs, and be a
bit more tolerant of the weaknesses of others. I have been aware for some
time of the very great pressure that RAEB affairs was placing on you and
of the demands oh your time which it is making* You of all the people X
know in the organization ire big enough to handle it, however, and I an.
completely confident that you will continue to do so*
Loving you like a brother, I suggest that you write Frank Schooley with
carbons to other members of the Board reaffirming the fact that you do need
a statement from him but apologizing for the bruskness of the letter you
sent under the date of December 28. I think it will warm up a cold spot
that your other letter created. Furthermore, don’t let me hear ary more
baby-talk about quitting an office because it has run into some snags.
